zone.line: secret things of love even more than
Petrarch. His Vita nova is an
inexhaustible fountain of purity
of sentiment & language: it is the
idealised history of that period &
those intervals of his life, which
were dedicated to Love. His
apotheosis of Beatrice in Paradise
& the gradations of his own love
& her loveliness by the gradations
of which as by steps he feigns
himself to have ascended to the
throne of the Supreme Cause,
is the most glorious creation
imagination
of modern poetry. The acutest critics
have justly reversed the judgement of
the order vulgar, & the order of the
great acts of the "Divine Drama"
in the measure of the admiration
which they accord to the Hell
